title: Locally Scale Invariant Chern-Simons Actions in 3+1 Dimensions and Their Emergence From 4+2 Dimensional 2T-Physics
abstract: arXiv:2405.05510v2 Announce Type: replace  Abstract: The traditional Chern-Simons (CS) terms in 3+1 dimensions that modify General Relativity (GR), Quantum Chromodynamics (QCD), and Quantum Electrodynamics (QED), typically lack scale invariance. However, a locally scale invariant and geodesically complete framework for the Standard Model (SM) coupled to GR was previously constructed by employing a tailored form of local scale (Weyl) symmetry. This refined SM+GR model closely resembles the conventional SM in subatomic realms where gravitational effects are negligible. Nevertheless, it offers an intriguing prediction: the emergence of new physics beyond the traditional SM and GR near spacetime singularities, characterized by intense gravity and substantial deviations in the Higgs field. tldr: 该文章发展了一种新的框架，其中包含了引力、量子色动力学和量子电动力学的局部分布义康托夫斯（Chern-Simons）项，这些项在3+1维空间中具有局部尺度不变性。这些新的尺度不变性使得原有的标准模型与广义相对论相结合的模型在时空奇点附近出现了新的物理现象，特别是与强引力场相关的预测与标准模型的预测存在显著差异。
